One example of a cloud-based solution for managing and automating complex IoT networks is the Microsoft Azure IoT Suite. This suite includes a variety of tools and services for managing IoT devices, collecting and analyzing data, and automating workflows.

The Azure IoT Suite includes several features designed to optimize network performance while minimizing costs. For example, it includes a device management service that allows for remote device updates and configuration, reducing the need for manual intervention and lowering maintenance costs.

The suite also includes a data collection and analysis service that can help organizations identify trends and patterns in their data, helping them to optimize their networks and reduce downtime. Additionally, the suite includes a range of security and compliance features, helping to protect data and ensure regulatory compliance.

Other cloud-based solutions for managing and automating complex IoT networks include IBM Watson IoT, AWS IoT, and Google Cloud IoT. These solutions offer similar features and benefits and can help organizations to optimize their networks, reduce costs, and improve performance.
